units.title: Prepare HBSS/BSA/glucose + DNase dish
units.text:
1. Turn on rotating oven and allow it to heat up to 37 °C while you prepare your sample.
2. Obtain a 60 mm cell culture dish containing ~7 mL of HBSS/BSA/glucose.
3. Add 150 µL of pre-aliquoted DNase (10 mg/mL) to each dish.
units.rationale: These are actionable preparation steps for the dissociation buffer with critical reagent addition.

units.title: Cut brain tissue into small chunks
units.text: 6. With a scalpel, cut tissue into small (~2 mm × 2 mm chunks) in HBSS/BSA/glucose + DNase solution in a sterile environment (Fig. 2).
units.rationale: This is a precise, hands-on procedural step essential for effective tissue digestion.

units.title: Distribute tissue into conical tubes with collagenase/dispase
units.text:
7. Distribute tissue into three 15 mL conical tubes.
 • Aliquot the tissue–buffer solution in the dish into the tubes first
 • Use extra HBSS/BSA/glucose buffer to wash the dish and make up to 5 mL per tube
8. Add 167 µL of collagenase/dispase (100 mg/mL) to each tube. Please note, 167 µL of collagenase/dispase per 5 mL is equivalent to 33.4 µL of solution per 1 mL.
units.rationale: This step details exact volumes and distribution critical for enzymatic digestion consistency.

units.title: Digest tissue in rotating oven
units.text: 9. Digest for 30 min in rotating oven at 37 °C.
units.rationale: This is a time- and temperature-controlled procedural step critical for cell yield.

units.title: Spin down digested tissue
units.rationale: This centrifugation step is a standard, actionable protocol unit for pellet collection.

units.title: Prepare Percoll density gradient
units.text:
14. Obtain two additional 15 mL conical tubes per each sample tube. For example, for three sample digestion tubes, obtain six tubes for Percoll filtration.
15. Dispense 4 mL of 22% Percoll into each new conical tube.
units.rationale: These steps specify exact tube preparation and reagent volumes for density gradient setup.

units.title: Layer cell suspension on Percoll
units.text:
16. Carefully dispense cell suspension from each sample tube into the new conical tubes containing 22% Percoll in equal amounts. Use ~750 µL per tube.
 ▲ Critical step The cell suspension should be dispensed on top of the Percoll.
units.rationale: This is a critical, technique-sensitive step requiring precise layering to enable density separation.

units.title: Centrifuge for Percoll gradient separation
units.text: 17. Spin down for 10 min at 500g, 4 °C with no deceleration.
units.rationale: This centrifugation condition is a defined protocol unit for gradient-based cell separation.

units.title: Prepare master mix for immunostaining
units.text:
22. Add 200 µL of HBSS/BSA/glucose into a fresh tube.
23. Add 2 µL of each antibody and 1 µL of DAPI into the tube containing 200 µL of HBSS/BSA/glucose per sample.
Ab/Stain Dilution Volume
DAPI 1:200 1 μL
CD45 PE–Cy7 1:100 2 μL
CD146 PE 1:100 2 μL
ANPEP APC 1:100 2 μL
CD31 FITC 1:100 2 μL
units.rationale: This is a precise, quantitative reagent mixing protocol essential for consistent immunostaining.

units.title: Immunostain cells and prepare for FACS
units.text:
24. After samples have finished spinning, discard supernatant.
25. Resuspend in ~200 µL of HBSS/BSA/glucose.
26. Add the master mix into the tube of resuspended cells.
27. Incubate for 15 min on ice.
28. Wash with 5 mL of HBSS/BSA/glucose and mix.
29. Spin down for 5 min at 300g, 4 °C.
30. Discard supernatant.
 • Note the amount of supernatant remaining in the tube; 500 µL of supernatant is needed to resuspend
 • Add additional HBSS/BSA/glucose if below the recommended 500 µL needed to resuspend
31. Resuspend cells.
32. Obtain one FACS tube and a 70 µm filter.
33. With the filter over the FACS tube, dispense the resuspended cells through the filter and into the FACS tube.
34. Seal the tube and place on ice.
units.rationale: This sequence is a complete, actionable immunostaining and sample preparation protocol for FACS.
